greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of standard Young tableaux for partitions of n into distinct parts with largest part k; triangle T(n,k), k>=0, k<=n<=k*(k+1)/2, read by columns.
comment: T(n,k) is defined for n,k >= 0.  T(n,k) = 0 iff n<k or n > k*(k+1)/2 = A000217(k).  The triangle contains only the nonzero terms.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Columns k = 0..22, flattened
maple: h:= proc(l) local n; n:=nops(l); add(i, i=l)!/mul(mul(1+l[i]-j+
g:= proc(n, i, l) local s; s:=i*(i+1)/2;
xref: Column heights are A000124(k-1) for k>0.
Diagonal and lower diagonals give: A000012, A000027 (for n>1), A000096(n-1) (for n>2).
Column of leftmost nonzero element is A002024(n) for n>0.
Triangle read by rows reversed gives: A219356.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 17 2012
